snippet: The president’s arrival in Berlin is being greeted with far less fanfare than when he gave a speech as a candidate in 2008.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama arrives in Berlin for day of scheduled talks to far less fanfare than when he visited as presidential candidate in 2008; observers say that Germans' view of Obama has undergone brutal sobering during his years as president, for reasons including perceived failings on Obama's part and acknowledgement of limits of presidential power.
lead_paragraph: The president’s arrival in Berlin is being greeted with far less fanfare than when he gave a speech as a candidate in 2008.

headline.main: Reception for Obama Is More Sober Than in 2008
headline.print_headline: Reception For Obama Is More Sober Than in 2008
